title: Manager, Direct Foreign Income Tax
content:
Get to know Okta
Okta is The World’s Identity Company. We free everyone to safely use any technology—anywhere, on any device or app. Our Workforce and Customer Identity Clouds enable secure yet flexible access, authentication, and automation that transforms how people move through the digital world, putting Identity at the heart of business security and growth. At Okta, we celebrate a variety of perspectives and experiences. We are not looking for someone who checks every single box - we’re looking for lifelong learners and people who can make us better with their unique experiences. Join our team! We’re building a world where Identity belongs to you.Okta is searching for a Foreign Tax Compliance & Reporting Manager to join its global tax team and lead Okta’s foreign (non-US) income tax compliance and reporting function. The ideal candidate is a self-motivated team builder with strong organization and project management skills.
Our Tax team serves a central part in the success of our business. We are currently looking for an experienced Tax Manager to join our team. In this role, you will need to:


Be proficient in leading foreign income tax compliance and reporting encountered by multinational technology corporations


Manage business-critical projects and workflows involving multiple stakeholders in a fast-paced environment,


Communicate well with cross-functional business partners with varying backgrounds and levels of experience,


Be a self-starter with deep technical experience,


Keep up on tax policy matters,


Be a strategic thinker who can problem solve and innovate in a evolving business,


Build strong relationships within Tax and across the organization,


The position will report to the Senior Manager, Global Tax Compliance and Reporting (US West Coast-based). 
Responsibilities:

Manage the company’s non-US income tax compliance and statutory tax provisions across the Americas, EMEA, and APAC, including management of service providers/accounting firms
Review foreign corporate income tax returns, extensions, and estimated payments
Assist with managing income tax audits and notices
Review annual statutory tax provisions and tax disclosures, including liaising with the International Accounting team (UK/Ireland-based)
Assist with preparation and/or review of portions of foreign entity US GAAP tax provisions, including return-to-provision adjustments and other tasks as needed
Assist Transfer Pricing team (US-based) with ensuring statutory financials properly account for transfer pricing adjustments in accordance with the Company’s global transfer pricing policies
Assist with special tax projects as they arise, such as tax planning, legal entity rationalization, acquisitions, and new entity formation initiatives as needed
Assist with administrative duties, including approving service provider invoices, budgeting, department planning, and hiring
Other duties as assigned

Required Qualifications:

BA/BS degree in accounting, finance or similar discipline
At least 5 years of multinational corporate tax experience with a public accounting firm and/or corporate tax department
Strong project management skills with proven ability to drive projects to timely completion while managing multiple competing priorities
Experience managing direct reports and/or external service providers
Proactive communication skills
Ability to communicate technical tax issues to US-based team providing oversight
Strong analytical skills and high standards of accuracy and attention to detail
Ability to identify issues and implement solutions
Strong Excel skills
Strong English language proficiency (verbal and written)
You embrace and advocate the Okta culture

 Preferred Qualifications:

Masters in Tax or Accounting or Law Degree
At least 3 years of multinational corporate tax experience with a public accounting firm and at least 2 years experience in multinational corporate tax department

The ideal candidate will work as part of a high-performance culture built around autonomy and responsibility.
 
 
Okta’s Top 5 Core Leadership Competencies are part of the deeply ingrained principles that guide all of our company’s actions. They also align strongly to our cultural cornerstones, our Okta values: love our customers, empower our people, never stop innovating, act with integrity, and maintain transparency. It’s our expectation that our managers and leaders embody these core competencies:

Builds Effective Teams: Building strong-identity teams that apply their diverse skills and perspectives to achieve common goals.          
Demonstrates Self-Awareness (EQ): Using a combination of feedback and reflection to gain productive insight into personal strengths and weaknesses.
Develops Talent: Developing people to meet both their career goals and the organization’s goals.
Drives Results: Consistently achieving results, even under tough circumstances.
Strategic Mindset: Seeing ahead to future possibilities and translating them into breakthrough strategies.

Amazing Benefits
